definition: to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)
to wash/to squander/to sweep away/to move/to shake/dissolute/pond

sentences.english: He was handsome in a raffish kind of way.
sentences.chinese: 他的帥是一種放蕩不羈的帥。

sentences.english: A suave charmer, he had a reputation for living fast.
sentences.chinese: 他本人魅力十足，生活放蕩不羈。

sentences.english: I have been wild and foolish.
sentences.chinese: 我曾經放蕩不羈，愚不可及。

sentences.english: Dana was a real swinger in her younger years.
sentences.chinese: 達娜在她年輕的時候是一個完全放蕩不羈的人。

sentences.english: Again dissolute drift on water unruly, always there is time of homesick.
sentences.chinese: 再放蕩不羈的漂泊者，總有想家的時候。

sentences.english: I have also heard that he leads a dissolute lifestyle, but that is probably just a nasty rumor.
sentences.chinese: 我還聽說他生活放蕩不羈，但這也許只是惡意的謠言。

sentences.english: He was born with unconventional nature but the traditional value and his conscience prevented its ebullition.
sentences.chinese: 其天性放蕩不羈，但傳統和良知又使它不能盡情迸發。

sentences.english: Since his father's death, the boy has had full swing.
sentences.chinese: 這個孩子自從父親死後就放蕩不羈了。

definition: lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
thick stems and broad leaves (idiom)/boorish/rough and ready/sloppy
the moth flies into the flame/fatal attraction
cultured and refined (idiom); gentle and cultivated
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
to stand aloof from worldly affairs
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
